channel.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
channel.description: Idk if I should take it or not. Can anyone tell me how hard or fun it is? I don't really know anyone else to ask lol.

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Physics is usually easy if you’re good at math. It was pretty fun and easy for me. Go for it!

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

I took physics last year. Thoroughly enjoyed, would recommend

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

It’s definitely harder than a literature class/etc. but if you like something that’s actually engaging, take it. I’ve found that most classes bore me to tears, but the more challenging/engaging ones can actually be fun for a change. Plus, it’s pretty neat to know how the world around you works.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @zuppers zuppers
item.description:
@zuppers wrote:

From experience I can say any class can be enjoyable but it all depends on the teacher.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

If you study, its easy.
But you need to study.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

I took physics for my senior years and loved it. It pushed me to apply for engineering at college. I actually topped the class which allowed me to get a scholarship. I deferred and don’t start until next year though. But you won’t enjoy physics if you don’t like mathematics or problem solving. Plus once you get into quantum physics you have to have an open mind and be able to disregard all the laws of nature that you have been trained to believe for 16 or so years.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I took it last year (Freshman year) and it is pretty easy if you are semi-decent at algebra. If you pay attention, and actually attempt to learn the laws and the calculations, you will be fine. That’s basically all it is, laws and calculations

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

dwarvenknight:

Idk if I should take it or not. Can anyone tell me how hard or fun it is? I don’t really know anyone else to ask lol.

Should take it. If you want to do anything in life that isn’t related to Language Arts, then take it.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“John459, post:6, topic:384461”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=480227.msg3515551#msg3515551 date=1298946402]
If you fire a rifle in an empty plane of existence at a 180 degree angle with only a ground and no other variables, the bullet and the shell will hit the ground at the same time. I personally believe this depends on the kind of gun, but w\e
[/quote]

It does not. every object is affected equally by gravity(they fall at an average of -9.80m/s^2 not counting air resistance)

Anyways, you should take physics. It is very enjoyable and interesting.[/quote]

I intend to. However, I am a freshman. This greatly limits me.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @John459 John459
item.description:
@John459 wrote:

reyx7:

If you fire a rifle in an empty plane of existence at a 180 degree angle with only a ground and no other variables, the bullet and the shell will hit the ground at the same time. I personally believe this depends on the kind of gun, but w\e

It does not. every object is affected equally by gravity(they fall at an average of -9.80m/s^2 not counting air resistance)

Anyways, you should take physics. It is very enjoyable and interesting.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

I’m going to take it Junior year.
I know nothing of it, except a question on a test some of my junior friends got wrong.

If you fire a rifle in an empty plane of existence at a 180 degree angle with only a ground and no other variables, the bullet and the shell will hit the ground at the same time. I personally believe this depends on the kind of gun, but w\e

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone take physics in high school?

item.title: Anyone take physics in high school?
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

Based off what the fellow seniors at my high school are telling me, it depends on the teacher.
I’ve heard it is hard, but we also have a clueless teacher who just hands worksheets and says do them. Ask around your school and see what those in physics now have to say.

Read full topic
